text:
Hi my name's Shay and I'm gonna show you how
to make some homemade corn tortillas.

Masa Harina is a traditional flour used to make
torrillas. It's gluten-free so it's good for

people with gluten intolerance. First you
put 250g of masa harina in a bowl and add

a pinch of salt and pepper. A little drizzle
of olive oil. Add 250ml of warm water to the

bowl and mix them until a ball is formed.
The dough should be soft, slightly wet and

you should be able to roll them into smaller
smooth balls. Put a sheet of greeseproof paper

on the work surface, place a small bowl of
dough in the middle, about 30g, and lay another

sheet of greeseproof paper on top and roll
out the dough to a flat disk. Roughly 12cm

in diameter. Repeat until all the dough is
used up. To cook the tortillas heat the grill

or frying pan on a high heat until smoking
hot. Cook each tortilla for about 30 seconds

on each side, or until each side is slightly
brown and little air pockets form. Use these

bases for your tacos. So there you go it's
super easy, my homemade corn tortillas. For
